commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk rdma

Vulnerability.Title: RDMA bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description:
Updated RDMA packages that fix one bug are now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7. Red Hat Enterprise Linux includes a collection of Infiniband and iWARP utilities, libraries, and development packages for writing applications that use Remote Direct Memory Access (RDMA) technology.
This update fixes the following bug:
* Previously, loading the ocrdma module for Emulex OneConnect cards at boot time, including those that do not support Remote Direct Memory Access (RDMA), caused the kernel to be tainted with the Technology Preview status. With this update, the module is not loaded automatically, which fixes the problem. To re-enable automatic loading of Technology Preview modules for RDMA support on capable hardware, the user can edit the /etc/rdma/rdma.conf configuration file for the RDMA infrastructure. (BZ#1422821)
Users of RDMA are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix this bug.
Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
